issues.description: The problem statement and template describe a Rideable interface (method messageOnRide()) and show animals (Pig, Seal) implementing Rideable. However, the solution repository does not provide a Rideable interface implementation — instead it introduces an interface named Mountable (with messageOnRide()) and has Pig and Seal implement Mountable. Additionally there is a Rideable.java file in the solution repository that is empty. This name/type mismatch between the expected interface (Rideable) and the solution's interface (Mountable) is a structural inconsistency that will confuse students: they will implement/expect Rideable based on the specification/template but the solution uses a different type name, and the empty Rideable.java in the solution makes the inconsistency worse (it does not define the expected interface).
issues.suggested_fix: Align the interface name across all artifacts. Either (A) rename the solution's Mountable interface to Rideable (and update Pig/Seal to implement Rideable), and ensure Rideable.java contains the method declaration String messageOnRide(); or (B) update the problem statement and template to use the name Mountable instead of Rideable. Also remove or populate the empty Rideable.java in the solution so there is no stray/empty file. This ensures type names match the UML/spec and prevents student confusion.

issues.description: The problem statement and the template expect an interface named 'Rideable' (with abstract method messageOnRide()), but the solution implementation uses an interface named 'Mountable' for the same concept. Additionally, the solution repository contains an (effectively) empty Rideable.java file, increasing the confusion. This naming divergence (Rideable vs. Mountable) makes it harder for students to map the exercise requirements and template references to the solution code and may lead them to search for a non-existent implementation or be unsure which interface to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the interface name across artifacts. Recommended: rename Mountable.java to Rideable.java (keeping the same package and the method signature messageOnRide()), and update Pig.java and Seal.java to implement Rideable instead of Mountable. Remove the empty Rideable.java file (or replace its contents with the proper interface) so there is a single, consistent interface name matching the problem statement and template.
